image.altText: A woman sitting down next to dogs.

props.synopsis: A group of Australian pet owners who say their dogs suffered adverse effects or died after receiving an osteoarthritis treatment are working to launch a class action, after a lawsuit was filed in the United States.

title.children: Pet owners consider class action over osteoarthritis drug

image.altText: A concept image of two workers in high-vis walking past a row of large batteries.

props.synopsis: A large battery project in South Australia sells for nearly $500 million as investment in renewable energy surges.

title.children: Millions invested in big batteries amid net zero transition

image.altText: Gloved hands holding COVID-19 vaccine, needle in glass container.

props.synopsis: Three local councils in South Australia have been passing motions questioning vaccines, but health experts say they are based on misinformation and heighten community risk.

title.children: Councils under fire for promoting vaccine scepticism

image.altText: A woman wearing sunglasses running on the road

props.synopsis: A trip to the hospital and some badly mangled feet couldn't stop Amber Bryant as she ran from Adelaide to Broken Hill to raise funds and awareness for endometriosis.

title.children: Runner completes 500km in the dark for endometriosis awareness

image.altText: A man in a maroon collared shirt is pictured seating

props.synopsis: At this year’s federal election, the South Australian seat of Boothby is one of the state’s two marginal seats. As part of the ABC’s “Your Say” campaign, we spoke to residents in the electorate about their biggest concerns.

title.children: Boothby is a relatively wealthy electorate, but voters still worry about the cost of living

image.altText: A man with pointy hair and maroon t-shirt smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: A man accused of the shooting murder of South Australian police officer Jason Doig has been found mentally incompetent by the state's Supreme Court.

title.children: Man charged over SA police officer's death found mentally incompetent

image.altText: Aliir Aliir of Port Adelaide catches a ball during an AFL game.

props.synopsis: The Swans are trying to find out if the fan who through an object over the fence at Port Adelaide's Aliir Aliir during their AFL clash is a member.

title.children: AFL fan removed by police after throwing object at Aliir

image.altText: Audience members in a red-lit room with screen at front saying Byron underground film festival.

props.synopsis: As streaming sees more and more people forgoing traditional cinemas to watch content at home, micro-cinemas showing alternative and niche films are rising in popularity across the country.

title.children: Micro-cinema subculture emerges as traditional audience streams at home

props.synopsis: After the death of Pope Francis, Catholics around the world are reckoning with the future of the church. Australia's congregation has been shifting and changing with the times.

title.children: What data tells us about the changing fabric of the Catholic Church in Australia

image.altText: A grey feral cat looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: Research tracking released bilbies and bettongs in remote SA has found feral cats are their biggest killer.

title.children: Feral cats killing more native animals than previously thought

image.altText: A large black and white cruise ship with a tug on the water.

props.synopsis: A luxury cruise ship will stop in Wallaroo in 2027, carrying almost 500 passengers, renewing the town's hope of benefiting from the cruise industry.

title.children: Cruise ships to return to SA's Copper Coast after seven-year hiatus

image.altText: A man in a white skull cap and cape

props.synopsis: When Pope Francis took on the challenge of leading the Catholic Church into a new era in 2013, he said that cleaning up a global sexual abuse crisis was high on the agenda, but some critics say he fell short of his own promises.

title.children: For many abuse survivors, Pope Francis's attempt at an apology fell short

image.altText: Proxy influencer Nathan working out

props.synopsis: Online "masculinity" content is mainstream and wide-ranging — far broader than the toxic Andrew Tate style manosphere or incel culture touched on in the hit Netflix series Adolescence.

title.children: The good, bad and ugly side of masculinity influencers

image.altText: A woman stands with a crowd of people behind her.

props.synopsis: From 1945 to 2022 Kooyong was Liberal heartland. Now it's a battleground as the Coalition try to reclaim it with allegations of dirty tricks from both sides being aired.

title.children: Liberal candidate accuses Monique Ryan of releasing 'dirt file' on her

image.altText: Shipping containers in multiple colours sit in a yard with freight trains parked behind them on a bright sunny day

props.synopsis: The International Monetary Fund says the US will be hardest hit by its own increased tariffs, which the organisation says is the biggest upheaval to global trade in 80 years.

title.children: IMF downgrades Australia's growth, with tariffs to hit US hardest

image.altText: An aerial view of cars packed into a suburban development.

props.synopsis: McEwen is part new suburbs, part rural towns and part established suburbs, and it is a seat the Liberal Party will be working to take from Labor in the coming election.

title.children: Why a congested seat in Melbourne's north could be crucial this election

image.altText: A composite image of three men

props.synopsis: The US had been pushing for an extension to the Easter ceasefire declared between the two sides, which expired on Sunday night, local time.

title.children: Zelenskyy says Ukraine to negotiate with Russia if ceasefire put in place

image.altText: Bailey Smith extends his arms

props.synopsis: In the heat of Geelong's epic battle with Hawthorn, a subtle interaction between Bailey Smith and a teammate gave an insight into how he has been able to slot into his new club so well.

title.children: Geelong expertly walks the Bailey Smith tightrope, and it could result in a flag

image.altText: A young Palestinian girl holds her mouth open to receive the polio vaccine.

props.synopsis: Health authorities in the war-ravaged strip say there are not enough supplies of a vital vaccine for 600,000 Palestinian children, as the Israeli blockade of the strip continues.

title.children: Polio vaccinations for Gaza's children paused due to Israeli blockade

image.altText: Half a dozen soldiers stand on a dusty road with one facing the camera holding a large gun

props.synopsis: Local police have described the incident as a "terror attack", while India's prime minister has vowed to bring those responsible to justice.

title.children: Gunmen kill 26 people in Kashmir attack branded 'evil' by Indian PM

image.altText: Doctor giving vaccine to a senior man in a medical clinic.

props.synopsis: Less than half of Australia's aged care residents aged 75 years and older are up to date with their COVID-19 vaccinations, despite being at highest risk of severe health outcomes.

title.children: Only a fifth of older Australians are up to date with COVID boosters

image.altText: U.S. President Donald Trump gestures with Jerome Powel

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump has again rattled global investment markets, this time with his threats to interfere with the independence of America's central bank.

title.children: Markets brace for more pain as Trump takes on Powell

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Monsignor Stuart Hall walk into a Catholic church

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese both paid tribute to the late Pope Francis today, semi-suspending their campaigns before the third leaders' debate tonight.

title.children: A not-quite-suspended campaign sees leaders head to church

image.altText: a huge ship with beams and pipe-laying equipment

props.synopsis: Santos's offshore Barossa gas project off the coast of the Northern Territory has won final approvals from the national offshore gas regulator.

title.children: Santos's $5.6b Barossa gas project wins final regulatory approvals

image.altText: An older woman with dark hair and black clothes dances with her arms up in a crowd, eyes closed, smile on her face

props.synopsis: Fresh after directing Interview with the Vampire, this Swedish-Georgian director tells a simple but stunning story of family, missed connections and making new ones in Crossing.

title.children: The cats of Istanbul are important extras in this luminous new film

image.altText: Meg Harris smiles

props.synopsis: Meg Harris claimed her first individual Olympic medal with a silver in the 50 metres freestyle in Paris, and it's that experience that is pushing her to a leadership role within the Dolphins squad.

title.children: Harris eyeing leadership role after 50m triumph

image.altText: In front of a setting sun, the silhouettes of two groups of three cheerleaders and a man looking on.

props.synopsis: It's a sport with its fair share of stereotypes. But as Team Australia prepares for the Cheerleading World Championships, its members say there's a lot more to cheer than Bring It On, wide smiles and prancing pompoms.

title.children: Australia off to Cheerleading Worlds after sport's unprecedented boom

image.altText: A chef.

props.synopsis: In Japan, it's called "shokunin", and it might be the reason why Tokyo is now the world's culinary capital.

title.children: This 96-year-old Tokyo chef has spent his entire life perfecting just one dish

image.altText: Caleb sitting on the beach digging a hole in the sand smiling.

props.synopsis: Locals are angry after a Victorian council deferred a vote on a motion to investigate ways to improve pedestrian safety on the road where six-year-old Caleb Wesley died last month.

title.children: Council delays vote on road safety motion despite Victorian boy's death

image.altText: A man in Islamic garb with a beard stands in Sydney's CBD looking at the camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: A former ASIO spy is breaking his cover to expose the activities of a notorious preacher at the centre of Australia's resurgent pro-Islamic State network.

title.children: Sydney preacher exposed as spiritual leader for Australian pro-IS network

image.altText: A bundle of leaflets held together by yellow tape. The title says Allegra Spender Exposed

props.synopsis: Unauthorised pamphlets attacking independent MP Allegra Spender have been circulating in her electorate, calling her "weak" on antisemitism.

title.children: Who is behind 47,000 anonymous pamphlets attacking Allegra Spender?

image.altText: Two people in orange shirts hand election material to a man in a red shirt

props.synopsis: Voters in the small remote community of Pirlangimpi on the Tiwi Islands, north of Darwin, have become some of the first to cast their votes for the federal election.

title.children: In Pirlangimpi, a long way from Canberra, voters are keen to have their voices heard

image.altText: New Zealand Foreign Minister Winston Peters gestures in a close-up in front of a New Zealand flag.

props.synopsis: New Zealand's populist party has introduced a bill to parliament to define women and men by their biology, preventing trans people from being recognised by law.

title.children: New Zealand populist party bill to define men and women by biology

image.altText: Man in car with another man in suit, with microphones

props.synopsis: Former Australian Test cricketer and television host Michael Slater has been sentenced to four years in prison yet has walked free after already serving more than a year in custody.

title.children: Former Test cricketer Michael Slater free after strangulation, assault sentence

image.altText: An atomic bomb blast

props.synopsis: The tiny Pacific island of Tinian was once used to cause the most devastating blast in human history. Now its 80-year-old airfield is being brought back to life, and locals fear history could repeat itself.

title.children: WWII airfield that set stage for atomic bombing of Japan set for revival
